image.altText: Metro bus

props.synopsis: Tasmania's government-owned bus company has instructed drivers to hide their coin trays while within a major bus mall in Hobart after a series of thefts, while a union says the government has reneged on a promise to increase security on buses.

title.children: Metro drivers told to hide money when within Glenorchy bus mall

image.altText: A white man with white hair and reading glasses in a smart-casual suit.

props.synopsis: With the state of the budget being a major trigger for Tasmania's snap poll, experts are urging both major parties to outline their savings plans and get spending under control.

title.children: 'Show us their savings': Business leader, economist on Tasmanian election

image.altText: Hand holding a magnifying glass over Tasmanian Government letterhead.

props.synopsis: The activities of Tasmania's 70 registered lobbyists, who act on behalf of paying clients to get results from the government, were to be made public from July 1, but that's no longer going to happen.

title.children: Tasmanians were weeks away from seeing how lobbyists operate — but not anymore

image.altText: A person wearing a black sweatshirt stands outdoors in front of a wooden pergola and a small building.

props.synopsis: Police charge the 46-year-old owner of the North Motton home where the shooting happened with murder, attempted murder and aggravated assault.

title.children: Leigh Sushames, 46, charged with murder of Tasmanian police officer

image.altText: multiple firearms laid out on the ground.

props.synopsis: A George Town man is charged with multiple offences, including firearm possession, after officers observed "items of interest" through the window of a home.

title.children: Police find 'imitation' gun stash while looking through man's window

image.altText: Hundreds of people in red caps but no other cloths run into the water.

props.synopsis: While venturing into chilly waters isn't for everyone, research has found mass acts of benign masochism in the wild pulls people together as they all experience discomfort.

title.children: 🔊 LISTEN: The pleasure from the pain of nude swimming in winter

image.altText: Man smiles holding poster

props.synopsis: Musician Julian Teakle hopes to prevent "cultural amnesia" by donating posters and handbills collected over 30 years of gigs to Libraries Tasmania.

title.children: Donation captures decades of Tassie's underground music culture

image.altText: Jack Muir-Wilson and his son at site of new Burnie Health Hub

props.synopsis: Two brothers from Tasmania's north-west coast are transforming a derelict university site into an all-inclusive health hub, with 16 permanent service providers.

title.children: Brothers working to transform old UTAS campus into health hub for Burnie

image.altText: Five empty chairs at NSW Parliament's Macquarie Room parliamentary inquiry into the alleged Dural caravan plot

props.synopsis: The committee will go to the president of the Legislative Council Ben Franklin to ask if he could request arrest warrants in the NSW Supreme Court.

title.children: Five NSW government staffers risk arrest over inquiry no-show

props.synopsis: Over the AFLW off-season, Hawthorn's Tilly Lucas-Rodd underwent top surgery, a gender-affirming procedure that involves the removal of breast tissue in essentially a double mastectomy.

title.children: 'Huge dysphoria': First current AFLW player undergoes top surgery

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a group of teenage school girls on their phones, wearing formal school uniforms.

props.synopsis: A company contracted by the government to assess technologies for verifying the ages of online users says it can be done privately, robustly and effectively.

title.children: Trial finds age assurance can be done, as social media ban deadline looms

image.altText: A man and woman slumping on their seats inside an airport

props.synopsis: Australians who were in Bali during a 2017 volcano eruption emphasise the importance of taking out travel insurance, following news of Mount Lewotobi Laki-Laki's eruption.

title.children: Australians stranded in Bali last time urge others not to repeat their mistake

image.altText: A hornbill looks through the bars of a cage. Others are visible in the background.

props.synopsis: The exotic pet industry is booming, fuelled by global demand for rare parrots, reptiles and other wild creatures — but in Solomon Islands, one of the Pacific's most active wildlife trading hubs, it is under growing scrutiny.

title.children: Inside the Pacific's largest exotic animal export industry

image.altText: A crash site showing strewn plane debris on country terrain.

props.synopsis: The Australian Transport Safety Bureau (ATSB) recently found that a 2023 triple-fatal crash near Cloncurry was "entirely preventable" after the pilot likely suffered hypoxia caused by a well-known, long-standing defect. So what is hypoxia and how common is it on planes?

title.children: What is hypoxia and why is it so dangerous on planes?

image.altText: A red and white plane takes off into the sky with lights in the distance

props.synopsis: India's aviation regulator had warned the airline about a number of safety issues involving other planes in its fleet before last week's fatal crash.

title.children: Air India warned about fleet's safety issues before fatal Ahmedabad crash

image.altText: An X-ray of a person's hips.

props.synopsis: A study that claims the popular OsteoStrong program can help strengthen bones in post-menopausal women is "misleading", and "should never have been published", say bone health researchers.

title.children: Study supporting 10-minute 'bone-strengthening' exercise called into question

image.altText: Indian Pacers player Tyrese Haliburton hugs former Pacers player Reggie Miller while surrounded by cameras at the NBA Finals.

props.synopsis: The NBA Finals are going to a deciding Game 7 for the first time in almost a decade after a dominant win by the Pacers over Oklahoma City Thunder tied the series at 3-3.

title.children: Pacers force first NBA Finals Game 7 since famous 2016 decider

image.altText: family sit in the backyard on chairs and blankets with drinks and kids on swings

props.synopsis: As more Australians rely on family to enter the housing market, the backyard of mum and dad is becoming an appealing option.

title.children: The backyard of mum and dad is a new way to enter the housing market

props.synopsis: The sides in Erin Patterson's triple murder trial delivered their closing addresses this week, with one calling the lunch a sinister deception and the other a friendly family gathering.

title.children: Kill them all, or reconnect? The key arguments in the mushroom case

image.altText: Man in glasses surrounded by people waves to camera

props.synopsis: Friday's decision was the second time 1MDB-linked charges filed against Najib Razak have been dropped.

title.children: Former Malaysia PM discharged but not acquitted of money laundering charges

image.altText: Police officers and vehicles behind tall palms on a hot-looking street.

props.synopsis: Police vow to "leave no stone unturned" in their search for answers after a woman's body was found on a Townsville street.

title.children: Police declare crime scene after woman's body found on busy street

image.altText: Fire engulfs a large double storey home with flames leaping into the air at night.

props.synopsis: Fire Rescue Victoria says the St Georges Road home collapsed due to the intensity of the fire, which is being treated as suspicious.

title.children: Fire treated as suspicious after inner Melbourne mansion destroyed

image.altText: A piece of slow-cooked lamb in a pot alongside lemon, fennel, potatoes and juices, topped with fresh green herbs.

props.synopsis: From lamb and pork to a vegetarian option, we're dishing up the best tips and tricks for warming winter roasts.

title.children: Four cooks share their secrets to the perfect winter roast

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has ended the week lower, with oil prices volatile in response to shifting prospects of the US joining Israel's strikes on Iran.

title.children: ASX drops, oil prices volatile as Israel continues strikes on Iran — as it happened

image.altText: Transmission lines.

props.synopsis: Decisions by the Queensland government to extend the life of publicly-owned coal fired power stations beyond 2035, expand gas exploration and call in certain wind farm projects has raised concerns.

title.children: 'Energy policy chaos' in Queensland causing uncertainty among investors

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne carries his bat, helmet and gloves

props.synopsis: Marnus Labuschagne goes from the world's top-ranked Test batter to dropped in the space of two years, after being left out of the team to face the Windies.

title.children: Labuschagne dropped for West Indies Test, as injured veteran misses out

image.altText: Sussan Ley press conference smile

props.synopsis: To the extent anyone is paying attention, Sussan Ley has made a better start than many, including some Liberals, had expected.

title.children: Sussan Ley isn't dealing with the media like Peter Dutton did

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: Former leader John Pesutto has expressed his gratitude to the Victorian Liberal Party after its administrative committee voted to lend him $1.55 million to pay his legal costs to MP Moira Deeming.

title.children: 'Grateful and humbled': Liberals save John Pesutto from bankruptcy

image.altText: Lauren smiles as she looks to the camera in a headshot wearing a white top, with her short dark hair down.

props.synopsis: For many people, becoming a bestselling author with a TV adaptation in the works is little more than a pipedream. For Lauren, it became reality by the time she turned 22.

title.children: Lauren googled 'how to self-publish a book'. Months later, she was a bestseller

image.altText: Flames rise into the air following an explosion at nighttime

props.synopsis: The company said the explosion was due to a "major anomaly", and said all personnel were safe.

title.children: SpaceX Starship rocket explodes in latest setback to Musk's Mars mission

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired woman holds a little boy while standing in front of a house bearing many solar panels.

props.synopsis: Hundreds more homes are expected to be converted as part of the Electrify 2515 scheme, which offers subsidies to households looking to cut fossil fuel use and power bills.

title.children: Scores of homes go green amid plan to run entire postcode off renewables

image.altText: Mugshot of Robert Paul Long in 2000.

props.synopsis: Robert Paul Long was sentenced to life in prison with a non-parole period of 20 years for setting fire to the Childers Palace Backpacker Hostel on June 23, 2000.

title.children: Childers backpacker hostel killer not being considered for parole

image.altText: A brown beetle against a white background.

props.synopsis: The WA government will stop trying to eradicate an invasive beetle called the polyphagous shot-hole borer and start managing it instead. Why is this pest so dangerous, and what can be done about it?

title.children: A tiny pest has been spreading through Perth. Here's how it goes undetected

image.altText: large, orange mushroom cloud takes up the evening sky over a woman standing outside her house

props.synopsis: From Trump's family business monetising the president's name again to a volcanic eruption affecting up to 14,000 travellers, it was another big week in news. Test yourself on what you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: New Trump merchandise, a volcanic eruption and the annual G7 summit

image.altText: Cocoa farmer inspects his beans on red trays.

props.synopsis: Australian cocoa producers aren't normally the cheapest source of the sweet treat's key ingredient, but with global supply set to tighten further, chocolate makers are lining up to buy Aussie beans.

title.children: As chocolate prices surge, Aussie cocoa growers are in the sweet spot
